Package departmentTicketer

Class Quiq

  • java.lang.Object
    • departmentTicketer.Quiq
  • public class Quiq
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to interact with the quiq API is was made such that you could use it in another program without any issues.
    Since:
    3/15/2022
    Author:
    Braden Hansen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Quiq.Response
      The response class is used to convert the JSON from the post request response to a POJO (Plain Old Java Object).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Quiq​(java.lang.String basePath, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String secret)
      This constructor sets the variables needed to make each call

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String acceptConversation​(java.lang.String convoId)
      Accepts a conversation, conversation must be offered to you to accept it.

      Changes the queue of a conversation.
      java.lang.String rejectConversation​(java.lang.String convoId)

      Sends a message to a conversation.

      Sends a notification the the requestor.
      Quiq.Response startConversation​(java.lang.String handle, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String contactPoint)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quiq

        public Quiq​(java.lang.String basePath,
            java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String secret)
        This constructor sets the variables needed to make each call
        Parameters:
        basePath - the url used to access quiq
        username - a unique id given with the api key for quiq. It is not actually your quiq username.
        secret - a secret given as an api key for a user from quiq

    • Method Detail

      • startConversation

        public Quiq.Response startConversation​(java.lang.String handle,
                                       java.lang.String message,
                                       java.lang.String contactPoint)
                                throws org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Starts a conversation with the requestor via sms
        Parameters:
        handle - The phone number of the requestor.
        message - The message to be sent to the phone number.
        contactPoint - The Quiq contact point the message should come from. See quiq contact points here
        Returns:
        a Quiq.Response object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
        org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler

      • sendMessage

        public Quiq.Response sendMessage​(java.lang.String convoId,
                                 java.lang.String message)
                          throws org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Sends a message to a conversation. You must own the conversation to be able to send a message to it.
        Parameters:
        convoId - The conversation ID to send a message to, always starts with 'cid.' followed by numbers.
        message - The message to send to the conversation.
        Returns:
        a Quiq.Response object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
        org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler

      • sendNotification

        public Quiq.Response sendNotification​(java.lang.String handle,
                                      java.lang.String message,
                                      java.lang.String contactPoint)
                               throws org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Sends a notification the the requestor. Notifications can be sent to conversations you don't own. But the agent who owns it won't be able to see your message.
        Parameters:
        handle - The phone number of the requestor.
        message - The message to be sent to the phone number.
        contactPoint - The Quiq contact point the message should come from. See quiq contact points here
        Returns:
        a Quiq.Response object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
        org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler

      • changeQueue

        public java.lang.String changeQueue​(java.lang.String conversationId,
                                    java.lang.String targetQueue)
                             throws org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Changes the queue of a conversation. You must own the conversation to change the queue.
        Parameters:
        conversationId - The conversation ID to send a message to, always starts with 'cid.' followed by numbers.
        targetQueue - The queue you would like the conversation to go to. See quiq queues here
        Returns:
        a string, quiq did not implement a response schema for this endpoint, it just returns an http response code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
        org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler

      • acceptConversation

        public java.lang.String acceptConversation​(java.lang.String convoId)
                                    throws org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        Accepts a conversation, conversation must be offered to you to accept it.
        Parameters:
        convoId - The conversation ID to send a message to, always starts with 'cid.' followed by numbers.
        Returns:
        a string, quiq did not implement a response schema for this endpoint, it just returns an http response code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
        org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler

      • rejectConversation

        public java.lang.String rejectConversation​(java.lang.String convoId)
                                    throws org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        Rejects a conversation, conversation must be offered to you to reject it.
        Parameters:
        convoId - The conversation ID to send a message to, always starts with 'cid.' followed by numbers.
        Returns:
        a string, quiq did not implement a response schema for this endpoint, it just returns an http response code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
        org.apache.http.auth.AuthenticationException - I was too lazy to handle these in each method so there is a blanket catch in the message handler
